parametrized_description: A factory has two types of machines, A and B. Each day, machine A can produce ProductionA items and consumes EnergyA kWh. Machine B can produce ProductionB items and consumes EnergyB kWh per day. The factory must produce at least MinProduction items per day and has MaxEnergy kWh of electricity available per day. Due to limited workers, at most MaxPercentB of the machines can be of type B. Additionally, at least MinA machines of type A must be used. The objective is to determine the number of each machine to minimize the total number of machines.

ProductionA.description: Production rate of Machine A in items per day

ProductionB.description: Production rate of Machine B in items per day

EnergyA.description: Energy consumption of Machine A in kWh per day

EnergyB.description: Energy consumption of Machine B in kWh per day

MinProduction.description: Minimum required production in items per day

MaxEnergy.description: Maximum available energy in kWh per day

MaxPercentB.description: Maximum percentage of machines that can be of type B

MinA.description: Minimum number of machines of type A

NumberA.description: The number of machines of type A

NumberB.description: The number of machines of type B

constraints.description: The total production by machines of type A and B must be at least MinProduction items per day.
The total energy consumption by machines of type A and B must not exceed MaxEnergy kWh per day.
At most MaxPercentB percentage of the machines can be of type B.
At least MinA machines of type A must be used.

objective.description: Minimize the total number of machines of type A and B used in the factory.
